website_summaries.verdict: Nikon's AF-S Nikkor 28mm f/1.8G is a fast wide-angle optic that is incredible sharp—and affordably priced.

customer_reviews.title: Top notch Prime lens !!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens for landscape photography, and I am so glad I did. Absolute cracking sharp lens. Light, portable, 77mm filter thread. Makes fabulous sunstars. It is my go to lens for landscaping. Fabulous....well worth every single penny :)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa V

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens
customer_reviews.text: I really like this lens as it renders lovely images, perfect for landscape shots. Ive also used it for some very good night time shots of the Aurora Borealis as the f1.8 aperture lets in plenty of light. Amazon please note: This is not a lens for 'portrait photography', I am unsure why the category.
customer_reviews.author: NG

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: This is a Wonderfull focal length for landscape and everyday use. I already have a 20mm f1.8g and the 24g and 35g. This lens is the one that gets the most use.
customer_reviews.author: DUDE

customer_reviews.title: Don't think about it, just buy
customer_reviews.text: This must be the best lens I have ever bought, it is not too heavy, unlike my trinity of zooms. The sharpness is breathtaking from corner to corner. The distortion is minimal and the colours and contrast are perfect for me. Incredible
customer_reviews.author: JB503

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much flawless unless you're bothered by the construction materials
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much flawless unless you're bothered by the construction materials. But it's built to a budget and for cameras that doesnt require the lens to have an aperture ring, and its brilliantly sharp across the frame and throughout the aperture range, so perfect for shooting landscapes.
customer_reviews.author: dw300

customer_reviews.title: Is it sharp? Yes!
customer_reviews.text: I'll let you judge how sharp this lens is from my photos (handheld on a D700) Fairly inexpensive for a 'N' lens and versatile Reasonably lightweight I'd recommend a Hoya filter (I have the PRO1 digital) in order to protect the front element
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice light lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is a great little lens. It's sharp. Great for night photography. And is nice and light to carry in your kit bag with filters and other stuff.
customer_reviews.author: jules

customer_reviews.title: It's sharpness is second to none easy to carry too
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying this lens. It's sharpness is second to none easy to carry too. Really enhances my D810.
customer_reviews.author: Spex

customer_reviews.title: Great lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great lens. Small, light and great image quality. It's sharp and has a really nice bokeh. The build quality is only so-so - feels a bit cheap in the hand but the plus side to this is the (lack of) weight.
customer_reviews.author: SCH

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Massive colour fringing. Blue tint in night photos. Very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Geotzen

customer_reviews.title: Great performance and fast
customer_reviews.text: Whta to say about this lens. Great performance and fast. My only reservation is that it is a bit bulky.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. Bain

customer_reviews.title: Takes great photos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens for a trip and it produces stunning, sharp pictures. Great low light performance too!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: A Nikon prime which is Top Draw
customer_reviews.text: Everything I could wish for optically in a 20mm fixed prime, fast and light, with images that are quite simply stunning. A classic and beautiful Nikon Prime.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lens
customer_reviews.text: Great lens; portable, very sharp, great colours. Impressive bokeh. Well engineered product from Nikon.
customer_reviews.author: Minolta10

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far proving to be a very good buy. Very sharp and light to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Appaloosa

customer_reviews.title: Great lens.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a wide angle to compliment existing 28-300 lens. This is perfect for working during wedding do's and am so glad I had rejected the 16-35mm a few months earlier as being too bulky. This 20mm lens is light in weight. No need for me to sing it's praises; you can read them from lab and pro users' web sites. I also like the 77mm filter size (same as other lenses in the collection) and recent Nikon cameras can correct the vignetting in the firmware.
customer_reviews.author: Exploration HSE Advisor

customer_reviews.title: Poor QC
customer_reviews.text: Mine was soft at anything other than close focal lengths, at which it was great. However, for landscapes and cityscapes infinity and near-infinity focus was very poor, and was returned to the Warehouse Deals section of Amazon - at which point they raised its price by £200! Unsure why someone would want to pay more for an example they didn't fix...
customer_reviews.author: DrNick

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results is it worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This lens is stunning. Amazing results is it worth the money? no but its a great lens.
customer_reviews.author: Some bloke

customer_reviews.title: Great starburst effect around lights
customer_reviews.text: Stunning detail / quality across the f stop range. Used it on several low ISO, long shutter speed, landscape shots and it still continues to impress me. Great starburst effect around lights. Used it in low light, and hand held, underneath the Eiffel Tower and the detail was incredibly good. Would recommend this to anyone using an FX - full frame - camera
customer_reviews.author: Mr G.

customer_reviews.title: fast and amazing. good on CA
customer_reviews.text: sharp, fast and amazing. good on CA, not that good on distorting
customer_reviews.author: Razvan Danaila

customer_reviews.title: My first good lens, ended up being AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am still learning to be a photographer, but I loooove this lens, is really wide, even if I am using it on a Nikon D90 (that is a cropped camera). the resould is really bright due to the f/1.8 aperture, and very sharp, specially in close up pictures! Been really useful for few project I've done for a club-night and a baby-shooting! highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Valerio Santucci

customer_reviews.title: Better than the 14-24 f/2.8 & the Zeiss 21mm
customer_reviews.text: BEAUTIFUL Professional untra wide, I'm a professional and have used many lenses in this focal range, and this is the singular standout for optical quality. It's also small, light, and takes filters. The disadvantage of all this amazingness is the fragility, it won't take a fall well but it's a third of the price of an inferior 14-24 so I'm glad all the money was spent on the optical design and lens elements.
customer_reviews.author: COG Photography

customer_reviews.title: Pricy for the Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought mainly for property indoor shooting, e.g. showroom, staging. Hooked with Nikon D800. The whole experience of using this lens is half satisfied, half frustration. The picture sometime can be too much noise and less sharpness. It took quite a few test shoot to get what I need. So if you got a deeper pocket, go for Nikon AF-S 14-24mm f/2.8 G ED.
customer_reviews.author: V. C.

customer_reviews.title: great little lens
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens few months ago. Because of the size and price I started investing only in fixed lenses. It is the matter of getting use to have a zoom option in your legs :) If this doesn't not bother you do not hesitate and buy this lovely piece of glass. 28mm lens is very sharp, gives good contrast, and it's wide enough to use it indoors. I am also using it as my landscape prime lens. I highly recommend it !
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: 5G ED gives much better results at the same focal length
customer_reviews.text: I'm afraid I can't rave about its supposed sharpness so I returned it. The humble 18–35 3.5-4.5G ED gives much better results at the same focal length, albeit not as open. That said, from f1.8 to f2.8 there is so much chroma and diffusion this lens that it's not really usable for anything serious. The image looks as plasticky as the lens feels. I use a D800 but perhaps it performs better on 12Mp.
customer_reviews.author: snapparazzi

customer_reviews.title: A good lens, but at this price point it needs ...
customer_reviews.text: A good lens, but at this price point it needs to be excellent, not just good! Sent back for refund.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: This is one of my favorite lenses in the collection
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite lenses in the collection. I often use it with my Nikon D7200 since I really like the field of view and perspective of this lens on a cropped sensor. It focuses super fast, silent, and accurate. It is a lighter lens, not synonymous with cheap, and makes it a great travelling lens. This is also a great lens on full frame camera if you want the full wide angle of view from a 28mm lens. A must have lens if you do a copious amount of wide angle work.
customer_reviews.author: Giang VuTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Must Have Lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is the perfect focal length. Not too wide, def not zoomed in too far. It was far sharper than I had anticipated, on par with the 85MM f/1.8 which to me is one of the sharpest FF lenses Nikon makes. Bokeh is ok, not as smooth as the 50mm or 85mm but still good, nothing you can't tweak in Lr with a circle gradient NR mask. I absolutely recommend this lens for portraits or landscapes.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent lens for reportage style work
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent lens for reportage style work. It is light weight, quick to focus and fast. The image quality is absolutely excellent, and the images have a certain pop to them that you often find in costlier lenses. The build quality leaves a bit to be desired, particularly manual focus ring which is quite crude for this price point. At least the MF ring turns easily, allowing you to fine tune focus on the fly with one finger. I wish the lens were a bit smaller, but I suspect the size is necessary because of the aperture and optics. Docked it a star for fit and finish, but optically you should have no hesitation when considering this lens.
customer_reviews.author: S. Flask

customer_reviews.title: No regrets for this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I finally have started to using this beauty. I love the wide angle for events or venues with limited space to move around in. It captures images beautifully, works great in low light, no distortion to speak of, focuses quickly enough for my needs. I shoot with a Nikon D750.
customer_reviews.author: TStar

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly versatile lens.
customer_reviews.text: 28mm is a super familiar focal length on full frame cameras (most mobile phone cameras are a 28mm equivalent). I wouldn't recommend this lens for crop sensors. This is my new "everything" lens. It's fast, sharp, not too wide and not too narrow. You have to get pretty close for any sort of portrait, but when my model is a 6mo girl it's not much of an issue. Autofocus is kind of loud and could be better, but image quality is superb.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Winter

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful image quality with amazing color rendition and micro contrast ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful image quality with amazing color rendition and micro contrast which gives images that pop, that look, that feel of 3D rendering. An all out stunning lens!
customer_reviews.author: John Rain

customer_reviews.title: It's my new favorite lens in the bag.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this lens. Paired with my D7200, the pictures are sharp and pops. This lens is my new favorite lens to use in tight spaces and its very versatile. I just love it!
customer_reviews.author: A. Escalante

customer_reviews.title: Great for indoor shoots
customer_reviews.text: I use this for indoor shoots and especially newborn. I love that it keeps sharpness, and gives me a wider shot. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: kjgal91

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp and contrasty, incredible depth
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly sharp and the colors EXPLODE on my d810, its plastic and made in China so the build quality is kind of tacky, absolutely recommended
customer_reviews.author: Justin Watson

customer_reviews.title: Nikkor (FX) 28 mm F/1.8 allows light to focus, in very dim settings!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect prime lens for my photographing indoor events! Perfect size for wedding receptions, high school reunions, conferences... really any place where I need to frame 4 or more individuals at a table!
customer_reviews.author: p deming

customer_reviews.title: Just enjoy it. Great angle for me for all purposes ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a truly outstanding lens on my d610. The photos come very natural and realistic. You even think of resolution, colors and other things. Just enjoy it. Great angle for me for all purposes - from landscape to cityscape.
customer_reviews.author: Alex K.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for Landscape and general walk around lens. Well corrected optics for both FX and DX formats.
customer_reviews.author: DENNIS MERRILL

customer_reviews.title: The perfect prime for me
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect walkaround lens for most purposes. The field of view is absolutely phenomenal, and there's next to no distortion. Especially on my D600, you can get a really slim level of depth of field combined with a wide field of view. Sharpness is amazing, it can hold its own with lenses far more expensive. Nikon's Nano Coating controls flare, but it also just seems to add a certain 'pop' to the images I take with it. Phenomenal even wide-open, corners end up becoming excellent around f4 or f5.6.
customer_reviews.author: Soorya Avali

customer_reviews.title: Great glads
customer_reviews.text: I love this lense. It was more than I expected
customer_reviews.author: daphni m. rivera

customer_reviews.title: Nikon wide angle lens review
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a new wide angle lens and after reading other reviews I felt comfortable in buying this lens. I have used this lens for about three months and am very happy with the images captured with it. IQ is very high. Colors are true. Focus response is fast and accurate. No need to say more. This is a top line fixed focus lens.
customer_reviews.author: patrick kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great on D800
customer_reviews.text: My 24mm f/2.8D does very poorly on the D800 and the new 24mm f/1.4G is too expensive. This lens is fantastic and the price makes it even better.
customer_reviews.author: Pro Photog

customer_reviews.title: Rounded out my "poor man's" Nikon Prime Trio
customer_reviews.text: In an effort to simplify my kit, I picked this up to go along with my Nikon 50 f/1.8G and 85 f/1.8G lenses. I don't shoot wide normally, but this is great in tight spaces. I had fast zooms and will miss that flexibility, but I really like how light and compact the primes are and the fact that they're 1 1/3 stops faster than pro zooms. Optically this lens and the 85 f/1.8G are some of the best bang-for-buck modern primes that Nikon offers. Even with the great optics however, I still think it's a bit overpriced. I would highly suggest getting a used copy or waiting for a Nikon rebate promotion.
customer_reviews.author: R. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive wide angle.
customer_reviews.text: Haven’t really tested the lens, the landscape work I’ve done so far is great.
customer_reviews.author: William W.

customer_reviews.title: Very good lens - just watch out for focus shift
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm pretty happy with this lens as I've been wanting a (relatively) moderately priced fast wide-ish angle lens that can also focus in very close. Sharpness, clarity and contrast are all very good, however focus shift can be a slight issue with this lens so just watch out (hence the 4 stars and not 5). Mine doesn't seem to be too badly affected by I can still notice it from time to time depending on the subject matter being photographed. I still find myself using this lens quite a bit because it does offer a slightly unique perspective (being fast and wide angle).
customer_reviews.author: Omar Mohatarem

customer_reviews.title: Since I acquired this lens and wrote my first review I have added a d810 to my kit and this lens is spectacular on it.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this lens about two weeks ago and I have nothing but superlatives to pass along. I have been shooting it on my d7100 and have found it to be razor sharp corner even wide open. The clarity is remarkable and the colors are wonderful. I was surprised to find it to be so light in weight despite its obvious superb build. I have found it to be superb for portraits unless you are on top of the subject where you can gat some AP distortion, The focus is tack sharp and incredibly fast and very quiet. In short. you will not go wrong with this lens. 5 Stars. -Cheers
customer_reviews.author: Owen P. O'meara

customer_reviews.title: Great for a wide view.
customer_reviews.text: For the most part it works perfectly. Occasionally it doesn't do well on auto focus. Depends on lighting and distance. In general I enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Eckstein

customer_reviews.title: Best in tight spaces and low light.
customer_reviews.text: Light, large aperture, wide angle prime lens is perfect when you're in tight places. I shoot a lot of events and often they take place in dimly lit hotels and I don't particularly want to be popping off a flash. Shooting this wide open makes it easy to shoot in low light and stopping it down slightly will add just enough sharpness to the shot. If their are any drawbacks it's the amount of distortion out at the corners but it comes with the territory when shooting on a wide angle. Price per performance this lens it hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Anglin

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, accurate and sharp.
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered this, I had some expectations of it being pretty good. I already have two of the 85/1.8g's for myself and a second shooter, and they are stellar. I tested and tested this before any projects, then put it to work. It's a great lens overall with the only real caveat being it takes a little longer to lock AF in very low (candle) light. Not any worse than the 85's though, so pretty decent. The distortions are minimal and quite manageable if you need to correct them. The CA is well controlled overall, but as with any WA lens, there is some. Lastly, this is a SHARP LENS.
customer_reviews.author: Dwegs

customer_reviews.title: Great lens!!
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a wide angle lens and the Nikon 28mm was the perfect choice and I don't regret it one bit. From the moment I took it out of the box it has had spectacular sharpness on my D750 and so far, no calibration needed! This lens is perfect for lifestyle photographers who do a lot of indoor shooting. This lens also provides you that wide enough angle (for indoor or outdoor) to get extra creative with your images :)
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Lens!
customer_reviews.text: I won't go into all the scientific specifics but just wanted to write a short note to say this lens is fabulous in real world application and will be keeping this a very long time! If there is a supposed focal shift, I haven't come across any situation I've been able to tell so far. These new 1.8G primes are impressive for the bang for buck aspect!
customer_reviews.author: Photo_Guy

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: So far the best prime lens Nikon has offered. Lens is more on the fragile side, but it gives great pictures from my setup on my D90. Natural colors comes out vividly with a great image blur that is more satisfying to the eye. Overall this is a great lens to be added to any prime lens collection and will best with both FX and DX Nikon DSLRs
customer_reviews.author: Shin Zer0

customer_reviews.title: Better than good
customer_reviews.text: I am slowly moving away from zooms (with the exception of my 70-200) to primes and I have no regrets. This lens is as good as it can get on my D700. Sharp, fast accurate focus, light and the "N" coating gives it a level of "pop" that you don't get with other lenses. I strongly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: John Tokaji

customer_reviews.title: 5 star lens, for people who wants hight quality, no matter how close or far you are.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lens by reference to some professionals who had used. I have been very pleased with the outcome, has a excellent quality approach. Of course, my camera is a Nikon D600, the lens can focus very close to any object. Its minimum aperture is F16, that's a limiting thing, this is the point to improve.
customer_reviews.author: fleterf

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am having a lot of fun with this lens. I get super sharp photos.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Tack sharp at pixel level
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lens to pair with a Nikon D800. It produces tack sharp, high contrast incredible photos without distortion, chromatic aberration or other optical problems. Even wide open, the images are amazing. This is perfect for travel, street photography and landscape. This lens is awesome. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: My favorite wide angle!
customer_reviews.text: I shoot this on my D800 and after fine tuning it to the body this lens is amazing. It is really soft at 1.8 but at 2 it is sharp as a tack. Build is so so but the image is what I love.
customer_reviews.author: Mizar Photography

customer_reviews.title: I love this lens
customer_reviews.text: This lens is super sharp, quick to focus, and light. I find it on my camera more than any other lens I own.
customer_reviews.author: Brenton

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING, SUPERB AND SHARP
customer_reviews.text: If we take the price out of the equation, (because is a little bit pricey) this is an amazing piece of glass, I have a d700 and from landscape to fashion, this lens has never let me down. PROS: Superb focus, silent and super fast Sharp sharp sharp Small, doesn't wait at all Cons: Price.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Yubi

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite!
customer_reviews.text: This lens does everything as described! I used it on my last hike in the Blue Ridge Mountains to take these photos at Grassy Creek Falls. I love the results!
customer_reviews.author: Gayron L. Shumaker

customer_reviews.title: Sweet spot for a lens that will stay on my D800 most of the time
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that it isn't 77mm to match all my other lenses. ;) Focus is very fast and it is very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: skyrunr

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, quiet, fast, well made.
customer_reviews.text: I found it sharp enough for my D800E, which is not so easy. It was quiet, fast, and appears well made. The fact that it is light weight does not have much to do with build quality. A good lens (or a good anything) doesn't have to be heavy and made of steel. I tested the autofocus and it was spot on. Looked at corner sharpness and chromatic abberration. All very good. I am glad to have a fine sample on the first try. If you want a medium wide angle for a fair price, this is a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Graham

customer_reviews.title: Very good lens!
customer_reviews.text: Sharp, lightweight, very usable focal length, and acceptable AF speed. A little plastic construction but it's ok. I use this for street and wedding photography in low light. It works!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Cava

customer_reviews.title: Zoom,  Easy For Old Age survivors.
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the results. But I should have ordered a 16-35 or 17-35 easier to use and with picture as good or better than the primes.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite lenses. Fast, sharp, light, renders colors beautifully, nano-crystal coat, relatively cheap. The lens does feel a little cheap in construction, but that doesn't in any way hinder performance.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Most used lens
customer_reviews.text: Love this lens. Still love my 50mm better but I can't always shoot indoors with it. I also like the 28 outside so I can still be close to my son. I have been using it the most now :-) very happy that I got it and could afford it :-)
customer_reviews.author: Carlee

customer_reviews.title: Cool lens
customer_reviews.text: The Nikon 28mm f/1.8G AF-S NIKKOR lens it's an awesome flash with all the features to take pictures wit a smile.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo A Gomez

customer_reviews.title: No brainer
customer_reviews.text: Used for about a month, overseas and locally. The lens performs quite well. It's bigger than I would like, but lighter and fast. No complaints so far, only about the price for its build. Using on a D800.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Yospyn

customer_reviews.title: Great Lense For Semi Pro Photographer
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it ever since I bought it. If the professional lenses is super sharp, this lense is very sharp. Sure it has some weaknesses compared to professional lense but it worth it for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: awesome. my camera is d7000, dx format, 28mm is better than 50mm.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: even worse than the Sigma 35 1
customer_reviews.text: way too much focus shifting with this lens on all my Nikon bodies, even worse than the Sigma 35 1.4. Get the new Nikon 35 1.8G FX lens over this any day of the week!
customer_reviews.author: Virtual Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful lens. Unfortunately it was damaged in a house ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful lens. Unfortunately it was damaged in a house fire only a month after I received it and NIKON doesn't have as good a warranty as CANON.
customer_reviews.author: Xemo Williams

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the Tamron 28-75mm at this focal length
customer_reviews.text: A good, sharp lens, right from wide apertures. This is as wide as I want to go. My previous duty 28mm was the Tamron 28-75mm f/2.8 (non-VC), but the resolution of the Nikon D800E proved that the Tam (though not noticeable on the D700) wasn't up to scratch at the left and bottom border areas at this focal length. If I had not been aware of the focus field curvature, I'm not sure I would have noticed it. This quality used to cost much more.
customer_reviews.author: Jacktar

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Prime Lens For Landscapes
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get on Amazon, so i had to buy elsewhere on this occasion. However, i'm delighted with my purchase, its a fantastic prime lens for landscapes and i recommend it highly. I'm currently using it with a Nikon D800 and i think its a better lens than the Nikon 18 - 35mm it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: G. A. Groves

product_meta.title: Nikon AF FX NIKKOR 28mm f/1.8G Compact Wide-angle Prime Lens with Auto Focus for Nikon DSLR Cameras
product_meta.description:
Bring a dramatic wide-angle perspective to your still and HD video shooting. The AF-S NIKKOR 28mm f/1.8G’s fast maximum aperture lets you create in nearly any light—dusk to dawn, indoors or out—and offers outstanding depth-of-field control. Nikon’s exclusive Nano Crystal Coat nearly eliminates the ghosting and flare seen with some wide-angle lenses for improved clarity and contrast. Impressive on both FX- and DX-format cameras, the AF-S NIKKOR 28mm f/1.8G excels with landscapes, architecture, group shots, travel and more.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER




Compact FX-format f/1.8 wide-angle prime lens 
Bring a dramatic wide-angle perspective to your still and HD video shooting. The AF-S NIKKOR 28mm f/1.8G's fast maximum aperture lets you create in nearly any light—dusk to dawn, indoors or out—and offers outstanding depth-of-field control. Nikon's exclusive Nano Crystal Coat nearly eliminates the ghosting and flare seen with some wide-angle lenses for improved clarity and contrast. Impressive on both FX- and DX-format cameras, the AF-S NIKKOR 28mm f/1.8G excels with landscapes, architecture, group shots, travel and more. 





SAMPLE PHOTOGRAPHY


Flattering portraits in any light. View larger 



Beautiful background blur. View larger 



The beauty is in the details. View larger 





FEATURES:


Nikon Silent Wave Motor
A significant innovation in AF lens technology, Nikon's Silent Wave Motor uses ultrasonic (inaudible) vibrations—rather than a gear system—to focus the lens, providing incredibly smooth, silent and precise autofocus operation.





M/A Focus Mode Switch
When fine manual focusing is needed, simply rotate the lens focus ring—M/A mode allows you to seamlessly override the AF system with virtually no time lag.





Super Integrated Coating
Nikon's Super Integrated Coating enhances light transmission efficiency and offers superior color consistency and reduced lens flare.





Nano Crystal Coat
An anti-reflective coating developed by Nikon that virtually eliminates internal lens element reflections across a wide range of wavelengths.





Rear Focusing
A system in which only the rear lens group moves during focusing, thus eliminating changes in the physical length of the lens during focusing and enabling faster focusing. Such lenses are designated with RF on the lens barrel.







How to read the MTF curve chart 



Lens Construction
feature_bullets: Engineered for Nikon FX-format D-SLRs.Approx. Dimensions (Diameter x Length) 2.9 in. (73.0 mm) x 3.2 in.(80.5 mm)
Nano Crystal Coat. Aspheric lens Elements

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars155 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
